required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of a Surgical Navigation Algorithm During Knee Replacements in Patients With Knee Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of a Surgical Navigation Algorithm During Knee Replacements in Patients With Knee Osteoarthritis

brief_summary.textblock: Ganymed Robotics develops a novel solution of surgical navigation to assist surgeons during knee remplacement surgeries. The aim of this study is to train and validate this novel algorithm.

detailed_description.textblock: During knee replacement surgery, per-operative images of the patient's knee will be taken. These images will then be compared with the pre-operative CT-scan of the patient using the novel navigation algorithm. The algorithm will be validated based on its ability to correctly compare both modalities (pre-operative and per-operative images).

primary_outcome.description: Comparison between peroperative images and preoperative CT-scan

intervention.intervention_name: Images taken during knee replacement surgery
intervention.description: Images taken during knee replacement surgery will be compared to CT-Scan that was performed before surgery

study_pop.textblock: The surgeons involved in the study will propose to all patients corresponding to the eligibility criteria to participate to the study during pre-surgery appointment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults patients who signed the ICF of the study
- Patients suffering from knee osteoarthritis requiring a total knee replacement surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient under the age 18
- Patient unable to consent to the study or refusing to participate
- Patient with history of knee replacement on the knee that will be operated again
- Patient unable to realize a pre-operative CT-scan
- Patient not covered by French Health insurance or equivalent.
